{{Use dmy dates|date=May 2013}} {|{{Infobox ship begin}} {{Infobox ship image |Ship image=[[File:ScoutMCM8.jpg|300px]] |Ship caption=''Scout'' in the Persian Gulf, March 2008 }} {{Infobox ship career |Hide header= |Ship country=United States |Ship flag={{USN flag|2008}} |Ship name=USS ''Scout'' |Ship namesake= |Ship ordered=20 August 1986 |Ship builder=Peterson Builders |Ship laid down=8 June 1987 |Ship launched=20 May 1989 |Ship acquired=27 November 1990 |Ship commissioned=15 December 1990 |Ship decommissioned= |Ship in service= |Ship out of service= |Ship struck= |Ship reinstated= |Ship honours= |Ship identification=MCM-8 |Ship fate={{ship in active service}} |Ship status= |Ship notes= |Ship badge= [[File:USS Scout MCM-8 Crest.png|150px]] }} {{Infobox ship characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption= |Ship class={{sclass-|Avenger|mine countermeasures ship}} |Ship displacement=*1,258 tons (light) *1,371 tons (full) |Ship length={{convert|224|ft|m|abbr=on}} (LOA) |Ship beam={{convert|39|ft|m|abbr=on}} |Ship draft={{convert|12|ft|m|abbr=on}} |Ship propulsion=four diesel engines, 2 screws |Ship speed={{convert|14|kn|km/h|lk=in}} |Ship range= |Ship complement=81 |Ship sensors=AN/SSN-2 Precise Integrated Navigation System (PINS), [[AN/SQQ-32]] Mine Hunting Sonar, [[AN/SPS-73]] Surface Radar, AN/WSN-7B Gyro Compass |Ship EW=AN/SLQ-48 (V) Mine Neutralization System, AN/SQL-37 (V) 3 Magnetic/Acoustic Influence Minesweeping Gear, AN/SQL-38 [[Oropesa (minesweeping)|Oropesa]] type 0 size 1 Mechanical Sweep Equipment, MDG 1701 Marconi Magnetometer Degaussing System |Ship armament= Four [[M2 Browning machine gun|M2HB .50 caliber machine guns]], three [[M240 machine gun]]s. |Ship armor= |Ship notes= }} |} {{otherships|USS Scout}} The fourth '''USS ''Scout'' (MCM-8)''' is an {{sclass-|Avenger|mine countermeasures ship}} of the [[United States Navy]].
==Service history== ''Scout'' was laid down on 8 June 1987 at Peterson Builders in [[Sturgeon Bay, Wisconsin]]. Launched on 20 May 1989, she was commissioned on 15 December 1990.
The ''Avenger''-class ships were designed to have very low [[acoustic signature|acoustic]] and [[magnetism|magnetic signature]]s to avoid detonating mines. While most modern warships have steel hulls, the ''Avengers'' have wooden hulls with an external coating of fiberglass. They are equipped with sophisticated minehunting and classification [[sonar]] as well as remotely operated mine neutralization and disposal systems.
On 25 June 1992, ''Scout'' was the first ship to arrive at the newly established [[Naval Station Ingleside]], center of the Navy's Mine Warfare operations.<ref name="NS Ingleside">[http://www.militarynewcomers.com/NRSE/resources/04ingles.html NS Ingleside]</ref>
While on a five-month deployment in the [[Mediterranean]] during 1999, ''Scout'' assisted in the evacuation of ethnic [[Albanians]] from war-torn [[Kosovo]].<ref>[http://www.news.navy.mil/navydata/testimony/seapower/krupp000323.txt Defense Authorization Request for Fiscal Year 2001]</ref>
''Scout'' deployed to the Mediterranean in early 2003 for a five-month tour in support of [[Operation Iraqi Freedom]], returning on 13 June.<ref>[http://www.uscarriers.net/mcm8history.htm US Carriers.net: USS Scout (MCM-8)]</ref>
On 1 April 2005, ''Scout'' and her [[sister ship]] {{USS|Devastator|MCM-6|6}} departed Naval Station Ingleside for a five-month deployment on the West Coast of the US, operating out of [[Naval Station San Diego]].<ref>[http://www.globalsecurity.org/military/library/news/2005/04/mil-050404-nns01.htm Mine Warfare Ships Deploy to West Coast]</ref> On 24 August, the Armed Forces [[Base Realignment and Closure]] Committee recommended closing Naval Station Ingleside and moving Navy Mine Warfare operations to Naval Station San Diego. The recommendation was signed into law on 9 November 2005, and planning for the base's closure has begun. Navy Mine Warfare operations are to be relocated to Naval Station San Diego.<ref name="NS Ingleside"/>
In September 2005, ''Scout'' and several of her sister ships participated in relief efforts in the [[Gulf of Mexico]] following [[Hurricane Katrina]]. The mine countermeasure ships spent weeks surveying waterways around the Louisiana coast and offshore [[oil platform]]s, using their high-tech sonar systems to locate sunken debris that could pose a hazard to navigation.<ref>[http://www.globalsecurity.org/security/library/news/2005/09/sec-050910-nns04.htm Mine Warfare Ships Support Hurricane Katrina Recovery, Relief Efforts]</ref><ref>[http://www.globalsecurity.org/security/library/news/2005/09/sec-050915-nns01.htm Defender Clears Way for Shipping off Gulf Coast]</ref>
On 18 February 2007 ''Scout'' arrived in [[Manama, Bahrain]], where she remains forward deployed with the [[United States 5th Fleet]].<ref>[http://www.navy.mil/search/display.asp?story_id=28031 USS Scout Arrives in Bahrain]</ref> ''Scout'' was transported from Naval Station Ingleside aboard the [[semi-submersible heavy-lift ship]] ''Condock III'', chartered by [[Military Sealift Command]].<ref>[http://www.news.navy.mil/search/display.asp?story_id=28029 MSC Delivers Second Minesweeper to Bahrain]</ref>
''Scout'' participated in a mine countermeasures exercise with British forces in August 2007, where air, surface, and subsurface countermeasures were employed in the central [[Persian Gulf]] to locate, identify, and destroy planted dummy mines.<ref>[http://www.navy.mil/search/display.asp?story_id=31636 US, UK Forces Train to Ensure Free Use of Seas]</ref>
From 26 February to 6 March 2008 ''Scout'' participated in another mine countermeasures exercise in the northern [[Persian Gulf]] with British and [[Kuwait]]i forces. During the exercise, ''Scout'' exchanged two sailors with the [[Royal Navy]] ship [[HMS Blyth (M111)|''Blyth'']] to foster interoperability between coalition forces engaged in mine warfare.<ref>[http://www.cusnc.navy.mil/articles/2008/027.html US, UK Engage in Personnel Exchanges During MCM Exercise]</ref>
==Awards== In May 2004, ''Scout'' was the [[United States Fleet Forces Command|Atlantic Fleet]] winner of the [[Marjorie Sterrett Battleship Fund Award]] for overall readiness.<ref>[http://www.navy.mil/search/display.asp?story_id=13803 Boxer Earns Marjorie Sterrett Battleship Fund Award]</ref>
